title: Conditionals - all three types
instructions: Complete the sentences with the appropriate form of the verbs in brackets. Use conditinals, type 1, 2 and 3.

sentence: If we had left home in time, we
(not be) late for the first act.
explain: It's type 3 because it's about the past and  there's past perf. in the if-clause.

sentence: What would you do if you
explain: Corr: were. It's type 2 because of 'would'.

sentence: Can you give this note to Bill if you
explain: We need present tense here because of 'can' in the main clause.

sentence: (hit) the guy on the nose if I had been there.
explain: It's type 3 because there's past perfect (had been) in the if-clause.

sentence: (not have) 6 sports car already, I would buy your Lamborghini, too.
explain: We need past simple because it's type 2 conditional indicated by 'would' in the main clause.

sentence: (accept) that job offer, that's for sure.
explain: It's type 2, so we need were here. And 'if I were you' is a special expression, so only 'were' is okay, 'was' not.
It's type 2, so we need 'would accept' here.
